1.title: Teaching Black History
1.plot: It's Black History Month and there is a new report out showing that most US high schools are not doing a great job of teaching the harder part of black history. Check out this week's #actionstowithstand to learn more about the Southern Poverty Law Center new report and Teaching Tolerance curriculum framework meant to help teachers (and all of us) do better when it comes to learning about our history of slavery.

2.title: Funding Gun Control
2.plot: There are a couple things I've learned gun rights folks are good at, internet trolling and supporting their cause, with money and votes. Check out this week's episode of #ActionsToWithstand to hear about how those of us pro-gun control folks (the majority) can leverage the midterm elections to make reducing gun violence a winning issue for candidates through our dollars and our votes.

3.title: Raise the wage
3.plot: After a short hiatus, #actionstowithstand is back with a new episode about minimum wage!! Watch how my brain gets from #InternationalWomensDay and a solid jobs report to the Raise the Wage Act and Fight for $15.

4.title: Voting is hard
4.plot: If some of these recent close elections have proven anything, it's that every vote can make a difference. Politicians seem to know that. Otherwise, why have 41 states passed laws that make it harder, not easier, to vote? Check out this week's #actionstowithstand to learn about these new laws and how to combat them.

5.title: 2020 Census
5.plot: You might have heard some news about the 2020 census and a question about citizenship being added. If you're still wondering why that is a big deal, watch this week's #actionstowithstand to learn why you should support the 14 states (*update since the filming of this broadcast*) that are filing lawsuits to contest that specific question.

6.title: The"prosper' act
6.plot: The second highest category of debt in the U.S. is student debt - that must be why it's such a memorable day when you make your last payment. If student debt is such a problem, why are the sponsors of the PROSPER Act trying to make it even worse? Watch this week's #actionstowithtand to learn more AND to see me do a little dance. This is one you want to watch till the end. Can you find the shout out to my alma mater?

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: Alabam Special Election
2.plot: News of sexual allegations against Roy Moore broke yesterday. In this second episode of Actions to withstand we let you know one way to impact the special election in Alabama - that is if Roy Moore doesn't step down ahead of time.

3.title: Calling Congress
3.plot: Compared to all digital forms of communication, picking up the phone and actually talking to someone feels like it takes too much time. Yet, that's the exact reason why calling your representatives is the most effective way to get your voice heard: it takes up time. So, when an issue really matters to you, be loud and proud and take up some staffers' time.

4.title: Corporate Tax Breaks
4.plot: All of the headlines about the proposed tax bills can be confusing. But one thing is clear: The GOP wants to give corporations tax cuts and wants to pay for it by eliminating standard deductions and incentives. In this episode, we have some fun with C-SPAN footage to illuminate the point.

5.title: Gun control
5.plot: Congress notoriously moves slowly on proposed gun control legislation. There are currently multiple bills that would affect gun control laws sitting in their respective committees. Now that we have seen Congress introduce and pass the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act is less than two weeks, maybe they need some pressure to get any of these bills moving forward.

6.title: Happy Thanksgiving
6.plot: It's Turkey Time. And the political environment is even more tenuous than it was last year. If/when opinions start to be shared today, here are four tips to keep the conversation productive and compassionate.

7.title: Net Neutrality
7.plot: Check out the new episode of Actions To Withstand to see our comparison to how ending Net Neutrality could lead internet providers to look a lot more like the airline industry.

8.title: DACA
8.plot: The newest episode of #ActionsToWithstand covers the basics on DACA, the difference between is and the Dream Act, and why it all could be coming to a head tomorrow with the pending government shutdown. After you watch, call your senators and ask for them to vote no on any year-end funding bill that doesn't include a Dream Act(finally, a reason to call your democratic reps).

9.title: ACA deadlines
9.plot: New episode with a friendly reminder that, for most states, FRIDAY, DECEMBER 15th is the last day to sign up healthcare through the ACA exchange (aka Obamacare). Unless you live in CA, WA, CO, MN, NY, MA, RI, CT, or DC -- if you need to switch healthcare plans or - if you're like me and don't have an employer, school or parent paying for your healthcare for the first time ever, head over to by Friday.

10.title: Elect Black Women
10.plot: Check out the newest episode of Actions To Withstand - where Kristin offers a way to get over your frustration with the white women who keep voting for sexual predators - by investing more in black women.

2.title: Ending Workplace S**xual Harrasment
2.plot: The women in Hollywood have declared #timesup - forming a coalition, wearing black to the Golden Globes and developing a $15 million dollar legal fund for individuals who have experienced harassment or retaliation at work. However, with forced arbitration clauses in 56% of employee contracts, there are millions of people who have no need for legal aid since they can't even take their employer to court no matter the claim. Watch today's video to learn more about the policy changes that could help give people their voice back.

3.title: 12 Days of climate sabotage
3.plot: Over the holidays, instead of your true love bringing you partridges, turtle doves and a lot of other weird gifts, Trump executed (at least) 12 different actions that will likely negatively impact the environment. Our latest episode dives into what they were but with a festive twist.

4.title: Martin Luther King Day 2018
4.plot: For those of us looking down the barrel of year two with Trump, Martin Luther King Day is a chance to remember MLK's resiliency and use it to re-energize and continue the fight.

5.title: Make instagrammable protest signs
5.plot: This weekend, the women's march is back. And of all the things I learned year, ensuring I have a good sign this year was one of them. So, we are keeping today's video a little lighter and going over how to make an Instagrammable protest sign.

6.title: Trump's Top Health Tips
6.plot: Trump's health is in tip-top shape. As such a fine specimen of health, you'd think that he would want to promote the nation's health. In this week's episode, we look at 45's food policy ideas to bring you Trump's Top Health Tips.

7.title: Guess Who? Federal Edition
7.plot: Compared to all the salacious news coming at us, judicial and federal nominations feel pretty boring. Plus, it's hard to tell old white guys apart. Is it kind of like playing Guess Who?

8.title: Nasty Galentines's
8.plot: Every woman's favorite fictional holiday is right around the corner: Galentine's Day. In addition to toasting the ladies in your life, why not add a little creative resistance to your holiday plans?

-1.title: The division of conscience and religious freedom
-1.plot: HHS' announcement of "The Division of Conscience and Religious Freedom", a unit that would work to protect health care workers who would prefer not to treat certain patients or provide certain procedures because of their religious or moral beliefs.
